website_summaries.verdict: A good option for households that use a lot of water and want to eliminate all common contaminants, including lead.
pros: Eliminates heavy metals, including lead, as well as chlorine and mercury
cons: A few users have said that the fittings that came with the filter didn't fit on their existing pipes

customer_reviews.title: PPM of water doesn't change much
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for a good filter, I ordered the water quality meter (ppm - parts per million). I checked the quality of water before the installation (was 450 ppm - which is horrible quality of water), and after the installation (became 380 ppm - which is also horrible quality of water). So that means that the filter doesn't work as it should, because the ideal drinking water should be from 0 to 50 ppm. That is the reason why I returned the filer. Don't recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Tsukanov

customer_reviews.title: Less then 6 months later I need to replace my two 3 year filters
customer_reviews.text: Disappointment is what I feel. I thought I bought a top rated filter with a 3 year life, But here I am only 5 months later needing replacement filters. I have 2 one on the cold water in the master bath and the other on my kitchen sink for drinking water. There are only 2 of us living here and I still use a 2 cases of bottled water a week, so how is it these 2 filters are needing replacement after only 5 months in use. The answer is simple there greatly overrated they don't last 3 years, they don't last 10000 gallons, they don't last 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Barry Koltun

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this water filter as a replacement to my Brita. It seemed perfect on paper. After installing it I wanted to make sure it worked so I used a water quality meauserer and to my surprise the water coming out of the brand new filter was virtually the same as it was before I installed it. I will try to return this product and stick to Britas from now on. It just seemed too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Castillon

customer_reviews.title: TAKE IT TO THE NEXT LEVEL
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on the basis that the extra size would help the filtrate process. just installed. smell no chlorine. taste fine. water does taste like my bottle water. tight access to install under sink cabnet.. did install in basement ceiling right under sink. Happy 3 years before change out.
customer_reviews.author: MONOLITH

customer_reviews.title: How to use as an external fridge filter
customer_reviews.text: See images. These are the parts needed to adapt the 3⁄8" lines of this item to the 1⁄4" line that supplies many refrigerators.
customer_reviews.author: K. Trout

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, Great price, Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Water tastes GREAT! This unit actually rids water of more than what is in the Amazon description. When we emailed questions, they got back to us very quickly telling us that the unit DOES filter out PCBs and VOCs, too. They have a PDF with more information, and I think it would be helpful to buyers and beneficial to the seller to post that in the description.
customer_reviews.author: wizard

customer_reviews.title: Woder 10k Gen II in linefilter.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed per Mgf instructions and in accordance to the additional information in regards to water pressure. After installation there is a significant difference in the cold water out put of faucet. 50 percent lower cold water pressure out through filter. Was informed it would not affect the water pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rated poor on filtration
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and came with all parts necessary. Flow rate is pretty good as I have it hooked direct to the faucet. Searching the web, I see it did very poorly in lab tested comparisons. Wish I would have checked before I bought it. It will help with water for cooking, but, I will keep looking for a better solution for drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: penchant

customer_reviews.title: Best tapwater filtration system ever!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. We like the fact that only harmful elements are eliminated from the water and essential minerals remain, just like natural spring water. And it was simple to install beneath the sink without requiring ANY additional plumbing fittings and lasting 3 years! For only $100! I used to envy my friends who had filtered water spiquets added to their kitchen sinks. They are great but allow only a slow trickle. The Woder filter allows a regular stream of water with strong pressure. It can easily be installed under any sink. I'm thinking of installing one in the upstairs bathroom so you don't have to carry drinking water all over the house! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Randollini

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do much ... according to TDS meter
customer_reviews.text: Hot tap water, meaning no filtration: 580ppm. Cold tap water, meaning filtration through this Gen 3 filter: 470ppm Crystal Geyser Water: 80ppm. There you go. This product is a scam. I'd give this only zero starts, but at least it was two minutes to install, and did not leak at all.
customer_reviews.author: Home Deep Peaux

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. There is a pretty big taste difference between my town's tap water and water filtered by the Woder unit. It was a slight hassle to install and involved 3 trips to the hardware store for different connector parts but definitely worth it. We even connected the ice maker in our freezer to it so we now have a faucet for tap water to wash our dishes, a faucet with purified water from the Woder and our freezer makes ice with the purified water.
customer_reviews.author: d c

customer_reviews.title: My filter comments
customer_reviews.text: Based on all the positive reviews I took the plunge and purchased this unit. The installation is a breeze. I'm beyond the average handy man but this device is very simple and easy to install. Use plumbers tape for added security. No leaks. I took a water test before installing and it was 5.65 parts, immediately after installation it drop to 2.44 parts per gallon. I know this says it takes a week before it fully engages. Looking to see if it will drop below 0.08 parts per gallon. I will update later on how well the filter is doing
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Clean & Clear Water!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I had the 2nd Generation one at the beginning, which was great, never complained about it. I realized later that once the life of the filter expired & I wanted something that I can change rapidly without having to disconnect the hoses & all, I decided to get the 3rd Generation type. It was easy to install, no complications whatsoever. I use it under my kitchen sink, which I also connected the drinking faucet to this filter too so I have that much more clean water to drink. I am really tempted to buy one for each of my sink of my house. I would definitely recommend this to anyone for sure.
customer_reviews.author: David Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Improved taste dramatically.
customer_reviews.text: I seriously wonder if the negative reviewers installed the product incorrectly. My flow rate did not change noticeably and the taste of the water improved dramatically. I installed the first filter in January of 2018 and am ordering two replacements sets just to have on hand for when I need them. Water is still testing great and tasting great. I have it installed in our wet bar so it only gets used for drinking water, no dishes or other uses. I'm guessing less than 1,500 gallons in over two years. If you are on the fence, buy it! Our water from any other tap in the house tastes bad but the filtered tap tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: fastrnu

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install, and I am a petite lady.
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about installing this on my own prior to ordering, but it exceeds any of my expectation. I am a single lady living alone, petite sized without muscular physique. I never used a wrench before installing this. In fact, I ordered a wrench and utility tape for the first time in my life just to install this water filter. End result? Event free installation that lasted only 5 minutes! No leaking, and I have great tasting filtered water instantly after! It actually took me more time to try to squeeze in under the sink than to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Cen

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Water!
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Woder 10K in less than 10 minutes. it took more time to pull out all of the different items one would store under the sink than to install the Woder 10K. I let it run for around 10 minutes on cold and then tasted the water. It tasted Fantastic! I showed guests this item over Thanksgiving and everyone said the Water tasted great ! The only down-side is that your cold side will have about 1/2 the water pressure with the filter attached, but when hot and cold are combined, your water pressure is fine! Great product, great price, and fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: JWalsdorf

customer_reviews.title: 10K gallons of clean water - worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a water filter on the fridge and its slow and the filters are expensive. we would end up buying water battles for the coffee maker and to drink. we finally put this in and it took me 30 minutes, a pair of locking players (Pipe/adjustable players) and a cordless drill for the two screws to hold the unit on the wall for a nice finish. after running it for the required time to condition it. the water was noticeably better and the pressure was close to normal. so water for cool-aid, drinking, and coffee (Keurig machine) taste better and no more buying water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: @LonestarCanuck

customer_reviews.title: Hooked to fridge water
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and has great flow. Ice from fridge is almost clear and has no taste. Luckily i could just remove my whirlpool in fridge filter with no plug needed and have this feed from under the sink. Worst part of the install was finding the correct adapters. I ended up buying a 3/8inch tee for the input and a 3/8F to 1/4 inch reducer to fridge. Then it was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: It definitely does slow down the flow of water, but not too bad. Improves water taste.
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely tell that the flow of cold water to the faucet is reduced by this filter, but I am fine with it. It does its job and my water tastes better. My wife and daughter agree. We all drink the water now, we never did before because it just didn't taste great. The install was just as easy as I expected, it only took me about 10 minutes and most of that time was moving junk out from under the sink and putting it back again afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: This filter is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this filter in January of 2018, and it has provided tasteless drinking water since that time. I just installed a new filter cartridge which cost $49.84 this evening and realized the old one had been filtering water for 2 years and 8 months. I have a separate faucet for the water filter but I am amazed it lasted that long. Our municipal water has a strong taste to it, and this filter makes it taste like bottled water. The initial installation took about an hour with a separate faucet and fittings. Replacing the filter took about 1 minute. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gill

customer_reviews.title: ACTUALLY REALLY IMPRESSED JUST LEAKS A LITTLE
customer_reviews.text: SO I RECEIVED MINES TODAY AND PULLED IT OUT THE BOX AMD WAS LIKE WOW ITS NICE BIG FILTER NICELY PACKAGED AND CONNECTED IT AND REALLY LIKED IT HAS A SMOOTH TASTE OF WATER MOST INDEFINITELY WORTH THE 100 DOLLARS MY ONLY PROBLEM WAS THE ON THE FILTER WHERE YOU DRILL THE NAILS IN N MOUNT IT. IT WAS CRACKED AND THE HOSE IS NEXT TO IT AND LOOKS LIKE IT WAS A LITTLE RIPPED SO IT DOES LEAK A LITTLE BIT OF WATER ONLY REASON I DODNT GIVE IT THE STARS. HOPEFULLY I CAN GET HELP WITH THIS LEAK
customer_reviews.author: RALPH MIDNIGHT DIAZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I (stupidly) managed to install the filter backwards as an ice maker filter (by making assumptions about the inlet and outlet based on the hardware coming out of the wall). As a result, the initial cartridge did not work well. The company thankfully sent a replacement filter, and now the water tastes great. As a word of advice, take the time to read the instruction book regarding identifying the inlet side of the filter, as the unit is not labeled. But once you install it properly, you can laugh at all your neighbors about how much they spend on refrigerator filters compared to you!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Installation. Fresh, Tasty Water.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely no plumber but this was an easy project. There was a bit of sputtering that lasted at least 5 minutes but that's to be expected. I haven't noticed any drop in water pressure now that the filter has had a chance to "break in" If any problems arise that note a defect unrelated to user error, I will update my review but as of now it deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Shocking! Within 1 year of light usage, on a separate faucet, small family, few glasses of water a day, on good municipal water, after one year the taste changed to a terrible taste like drinking water with dish washing soap left over. Shortly after that black specks were visible in the water, what I imagine may be carbon. Terrible filter! Thrown away!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Product works as advertised but the seller won't stop sending me emails
customer_reviews.text: This is a much simpler system than what it replaced. I haven't had it five years, so I have no idea if it really lasts that long. The water tastes great, though. It is a piece of cake to install, doesn't leak, and takes up a fraction of the space our double cartridge system required. I bought a second unit for our daughter's apartment and installed that in five minutes too. But the seller will not cease sending me direct emails soliciting a review, not just "do you like it ok" but a full Amazon review. I tried to ignore them but every week brings more. Probably a bot. Here's the review.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Enroth

customer_reviews.title: Best investment made!
customer_reviews.text: While I was constantly running out of Poland spring water since our tap water really taste nasty I was not convinced at all that a $99 dollar self installed filter will give my tap water a second chance. Well I was wrong, the filter works wonders and it took me literarily 2 minutes to install. If it may say so myself the water taste awesome!! Kids love it which I'm shocked to be honest. Keep up the good work Woder guys...and thank you tons for the water that taste so good that I can say kiss goddbye to shleping Poland boxes of water...
customer_reviews.author: Maven

customer_reviews.title: The installation is super easy and the taste of the water is incredible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this along with a new faucet about six months ago. The installation is super easy and the taste of the water is incredible. I used to have a Pur filter on the faucet and would have to replace it every month. Six months after the under-counter install, the water quality is just as good as the first day and taste worlds better than Pur! I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and does a great job
customer_reviews.text: The filter was extremely easy to install. It's great to have the flex hoses so you can reach the connection points (which you'll need to purchase: a t-junction is what is most likely needed by most people). I also like the fact it only filters out certain things (like Chlorine, lead, heavy metals, among others) and not everything else that's actually good for you. The flow rate out of the little drinking faucet I installed is quite good, so for that purpose, this filter won't be impeding any water flow.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Dies quickly, no product warranty
customer_reviews.text: So my system died completely within 8 months. The water suddenly became brown. I don't know why. Maybe the filtering materials started to go through. No idea. I send three emails to the company a week apart asking for advice and possible replacement under warranty. Not a single reply. When I was purchasing it and had product questions, the email replies came within a few hours. When warranty is involved, they do not respond. So, I will avoid them since the three year thing they keep saying is bogus and there is no warranty for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Cool

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 2 months, but excellent service & support
customer_reviews.text: Filter worked fine for 2 months, we keep a half gallon in the fridge, within the last 2 weeks the filtered water started going skunky after 24 hours. Unfiltered water tastes fine in the same container even after a week. EDIT: I contacted Woder support on Sunday 10/23/17 and received a reply the same day. I explained what was happening and what I did to rule out any other causes. Steve was very helpful and arranged for a replacement filter to be sent out. I was disappointed that the filter went south after only 2 months, but you can't beat the top notch support I received.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as described.I actually used a tee and flexible pipe to connect to a drinking faucet instead of connecting directly to the main faucet. I don't need a filtered water for my dish-washing activities. I connected my refrigerator line to the filter as well. I no longer have to buy a separate filter for the fridge. Since It will be only used for drinking water purposes. I expect this thing will last for 5+ years. Water taste great, I don't taste any chloramine in the water. $100 is a great deal. If you directly want to install to the sink then installation should be a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmet

customer_reviews.title: Most important for this filter to do is, make the water safe to drink and taste  good.
customer_reviews.text: This filter does what it is suppose to do and was easy to install. I use it on a dedicated drinking water faucet so it will last longer. I'am pleased with the purchase. Follow the instructions for proper usage. Flush before first use and the slower you run it the better it filters. I have found that if the filled container of water is allowed set for a short while with the cap off, the water will taste even better.
customer_reviews.author: Chipmeister

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this . Easy installation. Company even sent me a video link for installing which was nice but not needed , it’s so simple. Follow instructions for flushing out filter lines after installation (just run your tap for a few minutes). When I first turned on water after the install it was gray but after I flushed the lines it’s crystal clear. I can tell already the chlorine smell is gone from my water.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: A five star product!
customer_reviews.text: After several weeks of use, I feel that enough time has elapsed to review this filter accurately. First, the delivery of the filter was very quick. Installation was as simple as it gets, and installed as quick as it was simple. But, should you need help, you can find YouTube vids online from the company that clearly demo the installation process in a few simple steps. Finally, the water. There is a much improved taste than what originally flowed from the faucet, and theres been no decrease in flow or water pressure. For these reasons, I say this deserves a five star review!
customer_reviews.author: Smarlo36

customer_reviews.title: 5 minutes to install, so easy
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait to long to do this! This was so easy to install, less than five minutes. No brainer for anybody thinking of doing this, really. If you have a pair of pliers you can have quality filtered water in five minutes! I know I sound like a salesperson for this product but I am not, this is a rare easy to install product that makes for much safer drinking water. No more monkeying around with PUR and similar faucet filters and pitchers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We actually used the filter for our refrigerator water and ice system. The stock filters cost $50 a piece and are good for maybe a year, we drink a lot of water. The install was simple and the filter flows much better than the stock filter. It would take over a minute to fill our 40oz water bottles (may not seem like a lot of time but if your standing in front of the fridge holding the paddle down while keeping the bottle under the flow of water it seems like forever) but they are filled in under 30 seconds since switching to the Woder filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install - great tasting water
customer_reviews.text: I really need a whole house water filter but with the time it takes to review products to find one, I decided to just order these for my kitchen sinks since we all use refillable water bottles. It is important to me that my family has good water to drink from home. These were priced well and my husband had them installed within 20 minutes. Love it! Faucet loses a little water pressure, but not enough to make me want to take them off. It is worth it having fresh, clean water from the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: April Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, filters good, one line filter.
customer_reviews.text: This inline filter was easy to install (screwing and unscrewing hoses, and hanging it on some screws -- was a cramped awkward space for me under sink and behind other plumbing through no fault of product). Water tastes significantly better. I only attached it to the cold water line (you can't attach it to both), so hot water is unfiltered on my sink, but it's cool. Pretty much exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect filter all around
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered quickly and was easily installed right under sink as described. No extra large needed no trips to the hardware store. Right out of the box you could tell a difference in the water taste. I've had a in-line filter in basement for many years and moved to New home on a slab. I had my doubts about the taste; my in-line filter I owned before had a charcoal taste to the water and I had to find a filter to fit the housing and shot my taste. This did it all out of the box. Hoping I get all 3 years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex in Springfield

customer_reviews.title: No indicator for replacement?
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was an indicator when the filter needed replacement?, You're just suppose to assume it's good for 3 years?, Everyone uses water at different levels and since this doesn't have a separate faucet and is hooked up directly to the cold water it is being used for washing dishes and every time you need cold water other than drinking, Unless you use strictly hot water when you do the dishes you are using the filtered water for this also, And you have no low indicator for filter replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Brucifer Mephistopheles

customer_reviews.title: Works for eliminating odors.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd unit that I have purchased. The 1st went under the kitchen sink on the cold water to eliminate odors. We use this water for our coffee. The 2nd unit I placed under the master bathroom sink. I like getting a drink from the faucet before bed. We have our own well and the odor was present for only a few seconds after pouring a glass to drink. After installing these filters the odor is completely gone in both locations and the water tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P

customer_reviews.title: Wish we would've purchased sooner
customer_reviews.text: We wish we would've ordered this sooner. Our tap water tastes so much better. We could taste and smell the chlorine in our water, and even when we would make homemade iced tea, we could still taste the chlorine. My husband had it installed in 10 minutes. The very first day, the water tasted odd, but we ran a decent amount of water to flush the system. The next day the water tasted perfect. I purchased a set of 6 glass drinking bottles to refill, so that will save money in the future not having to buy so many cases of bottled water.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 6-8 months
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with this filter when I first installed it. It was easy to install and it noticeably changed the taste of our tap water. I thought it was a good value for a 3 year plus filter as they advertised it. Unfortunately after about 6 months, I noticed the effectiveness of the filter decline. After 10 months, I had to purchase a replacement filter for $50. Not so happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Santo Crispin

customer_reviews.title: Filter doesn't last even 1 year as compare to 3 year mentioned here
customer_reviews.text: I have installed in regular city (major metro) water and filter need replacement already. I am not filtered water freak ... never measured ppm before or after installing this filter ... I trust city is supplying us good water. only reason I installed this filter was for improving taste of the water. It did made a difference in taste. It was also easy to install. But it didn't even last 1 year and I have to shell out half the price of original system to buy a new filter. I was expecting it to last at least 2 years (if not 3 years as advertised).
customer_reviews.author: AKD

customer_reviews.title: Great initial improvement, doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned this filter for a year and a half and while I noticed an initial improvement in water quality, I just had the water tested again and the amount of chlorine and heavy metals in the water was as high as they were before the filter was installed. I am the only one in the household, have municipal water, and do not have a water softener. I am extremely disappointed that the filter lasted less than half the advertised time as that is why I chose this filter in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica R.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product! Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: I have the great luck of living ina contry where you can drink water directly from the faucet with no risk at all but the treatment the water receives from the spring till your faucet sometimes causes the water to have a little bit of 'weird' flavor. I wanted to get rid of that 'weird' and this filter was perfect! Really easy to install although we had to buy an additional hose to get the right size of pipe we needed but apart from that was very simple. No 'weird' flavor in the water anymore!! : )
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and flow reduction is acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was super easy. I had planned on running it to a separate dispenser because I was worried about losing water flow to my main faucet. I tried it straight to the main faucet first and I still had decent flow so I didn't need the separate dispenser. Water tastes great. There is a slight reduction in flow but it is nowhere near as bad as a screw on faucet end filter. My old DuPont faucet filter lasted a long time but it really reduced flow and I replaced my faucet with one with the pull out sprayer built in and couldn't use my DuPont with it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just do it. Sorry to change this to don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Supper easy to install really glad I don't have a separate faucet for filtered water anymore. Super fast delivery as well. Would happily do business with them again. Water tastes great. Update 24 hours after install had to remove it. Could not get it to stop leaking. Bummed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasted great, but had to return because it restricted the flow by at least 40%
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. The water tasted great. Great instructions and it was simple to install. Doesn't take much room under your counter. Seller shipped it immediately and it arrived in 2 days. Though, it restricted the water flow by at least 40%. To the point that I couldn't press the button on my kitchen faucet to enable the "spray function". I promptly un-installed it and returned it for a refund. P.S. I have good water pressure in my house. The filter just reduced it down too much.
customer_reviews.author: afwe2

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We like it.
customer_reviews.text: We had an old under the sink water filter that came with the house we had just purchased that was hooked to a separate faucet on the counter top. We already had filtered water from our through the door water and ice from our refrigerator but the under sink filter was really old and since the faucet was already there we decided to replace it with this one. It was very easy to hook up and the water tastes good. However this filter only needs to be replaced every three years so will be less than half the cost and we think the filtration is probably better. We will only use the refrigerator filtered water now for ice.
customer_reviews.author: rymea

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy install, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This works well. My tap water used to smell funny. After installing this filter the tap water smelled normal again. It also removed the bad taste. It does make the water pressure go decrease a little, but it is not enough to be a deal breaker. It only goes on the cold water line, so the hot water still was full pressure. All the hardware needed to install it was included.
customer_reviews.author: ArmyRiot

customer_reviews.title: Just like it advertised!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this item because it’s compact, easy to install and effective. Just like it advertised. I broiled tap water to make tea. The taste of my tea has enhanced SIGNIFICANTLY after I installed Wonder Filtration system. Compare with BRITA: water still taste weird, too much work and the dripping takes forever... Compare with professional water filtration system: they are expensive, and require maintenances (more money to spend) It would be great if this product has an indicator to show when to replace the filter instead of recommending switch filter after 10000 gallons/2 years. Overall, this product is amazing. I totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great so far, Very easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because my tap water was starting to taste too much like cholrine so decided to get a water filter. Its a bit pricey but with an est. 3 year filter replacement time, it should be about even with the 2-3 Pur filters i would go through every year or so. Install was easy, used a two 5/8 wrenches and my drill to screw down the filter unit. Water tastes great,i mean it doesnt really have a taste so its definitely filtering out the cholrine. I will update later when i replace the filter or if it breaks
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Set up took less than 5 minute. It was easy. Only tools needed was a wrench to loosen the nut on the existing cold water line and to tighten on the intake line on filter system. Other tool was screwdriver (powered) to screw filter system to the back of the cabinet under the sink. Ran water for 3 minutes as instructed and tastes the water, exactly as advertised. Clean, crisp an fresh. Odor is gone and soap suds better! We have town water that is heavily treated due to poor quality, or refrigerator has a built in filter, we added filters to our showers and now our tap water in kitchen is filtered.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J Gasdia

customer_reviews.title: I'm drinking tap water now!
customer_reviews.text: It promptly cleared out the chlorine taste/smell. So I'm willing to drink tap water again. For 20 years we had our own well and wonderful water. This year we became 'snowbirds' and while the water was OK to others it was not to us. Without realizing it I had cut down my intake of water....not healthy. A friend installed the filter, and the effect was immediate! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Kovach

customer_reviews.title: This was extremely easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to install, and the water immediately tastes so much better. My wife had preferred a pitcher water filter, but it was taking up space in our tiny kitchen (not to mention, the filter wasn't getting changed frequently enough). Our kitchen faucet is a spray faucet, so faucet-mounted filters don't work. Plus, again, who wants to change filters every month? Immediate difference in the quality of water and very economical. Hoping that it lasts three years, but if it gets close to that we will be thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install under our sink. The hardest part was getting under the sink! Connected to the existing fittings and was up and running water in 10-15 minutes. Don't have a way to test the before and after water but it tastes like . . . water. No chlorine which is what we were really after since we are on a very good municipal supply. Good flow - not feeling any need to separate this from the regular faucet. Glad we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Great water filter
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the bad reviews because of people using a TDS (Total Dissolved Soilds) meter to gage that this filter is working. This filter does NOT remove minerals from the water, hence the TDS not changing much. It does a perfect job of removing the stuff that makes water tate bad and smell. I've had this filter installed since October of 2018 and it's still working perfectly. Don't listen to the reviews of people who have no idea of what they are testing for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Even LA water tastes good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, very happy with this product. It was easy to install and seems to do a good job of filtering my water. I live in LA, so tap water generally tastes pretty bad. But the filtered water tastes very nice. I was using Zero Water filters before. This doesn't produce zero sediment water, but it's good enough for me and much more economical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this for our soda stream.
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a new house and could not find a fridge that would fit that also had a water dispenser. We have city water so when we bought our soda stream to reduce our can recycling we noticed a significant difference in taste. We found this and love the convenience of only having to fill one container instead of the fridge filters that you have to fill and then pour into the soda stream bottle. It's great that we will only have to change the filter every few years and our seltzer tastes great again!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and great flavor or flavorless
customer_reviews.text: Super quick and super easy to install. I used to replace an old 10K filter that finally lost it's abilities. This thing is great. The water comes out tasting...well like water. No abnormal flavors or nothing. I've had it for a month and it's going strong. I love the fact you can twist out the filter to replace with a new one when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: PMD

customer_reviews.title: I'd rather use coffee filters
customer_reviews.text: Nope, just flat out no. And I was kinda hyped from reading the manual, so I do the thing, it's all hooked up, no leaks, no Teflon tape either, no fuss no muss except it tastes exactly like those pipes that I haven't grown to appreciate yet. It might jave even enhanced the flavor. Wooder: What are you thinking? You lie to me in your little manual and so I buy a different brand 3 stages, now ive got Colorado grade tap water (if you haven't had tap water next to the mountains it's really good). The product is so bad I think the return include 10 or 15 bucks for wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works. I have two sinks. I can taste the difference between the one I have this filter installed on from the the one I don't. Unfiltered water was actually causing some health issues for me. Started drinking filtered exclusively and my health started to improve. I plan on purchasing another when my landlords maintenance people fix the cold water shut of for the sink that doesn't have one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install - Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Installation for this was a breeze and when running the water for the first 3 minutes after install it did not come out dirty just cloudy. I have no idea if the filter is actually removing what it says it should but the water tastes fine to me. It did decrease our water pressure just slightly and it wasn't that great to begin with so not too excited about that. I fill up a jug to keep water in the fridge to make it nice and cold like you would get from a water bottle. No issues!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Garrity

customer_reviews.title: Doing a great job
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solution for our kitchen. We have an old house. We replaced a lot of the plumbing in the basement and totally renovated the kitchen. We were looking for something to filter the cold water but did not want to risk loosing pressure to the whole house with a whole house filter. This was the perfect solution. Mounted under the sink on the cold line--filters water for drinking and cooking but the hot water remains unfiltered for washing and the dishwasher. Water pressure drop on the cold side is minimal and not an issue for us (I was worried about this though prior to getting it). Had our plumber install it when he was plumbing the sink. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install good flow
customer_reviews.text: The unit came with all of the necessary hardware to mount it to a wall or cabinet. The packaging and instructions were complete and clear. I used it as an external filter for my fridge (adaptors required for this purpose). The flow is very good for the small fridge water lines. I have city water that is not particularly hard. I’m not satisfied with the flavor of the water versus the fridge filter that was there prior. It should last much longer than the typical fridge filter, thouigh. Just don’t expect it to remove all chlorine flavors.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wyland

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't do what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Water still had a funky taste. I was really hoping I could get away with a $100 filter, but I had to do a serious upgrade from this one. Maybe it is great for most, but I couldn't deal with the leftover flavor of city water.
customer_reviews.author: tfunk02

customer_reviews.title: Woder 10K makes water taste great.
customer_reviews.text: Having this filter dramatically improved the taste of my cooking, coffee, and drinking water. If you have modern 3/8" cut offs this is a very fast install. Changing cartridges is a breeze. Very high customer satisfaction ratings helped me decide as well. It does slow the cold water flow about 20% but it is worth it. It was time to change my faucet set which helped in my case as well.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Angel

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Got this to remove chloramine taste from our water, which it does. It was very expensive, compared to comparable filters from other vendors. The big question is - how long before I need to replace the filter itself. This will determine its value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cuesta

customer_reviews.title: Flooded my Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This fiter worked great for what it was designed. But, I happened to be walking through the kitchen, I heard a pop, and the sound of water spraying! I hurried to the source and turned off the supply valve. The filter had blown apart at the glue seam around the top. Water everywhere! So lucky I was home and nearby when it broke! If we had been away when this happened, it would have ruined my hardwood floors! Maybe its only this unit that was flawed, maybe a bunch of them are flawed. Who Knows! I will not take this chance again!!
customer_reviews.author: xoft

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this yesterday as we installed a new kitchen faucet. Easy to install, water taste is much improved, and I like that this model allows us to screw in a new cartridge without disconnecting any lines when the time comes. Also, have had great communication from the Woder company about our order. May 2020 We now own 3 of these for our new home and love them. Greatly improves the taste/quality of our water. Two are on faucets and 1 is on the fridge (used in combination with the fridge filter).
customer_reviews.author: GinMT

customer_reviews.title: Odd packaging, water not much improved
customer_reviews.text: Filter arrived direct from manufacturer. Nothing else in box, no instructions or any other information. Had to look up instruction online. Filter was thrown in there covered in debris that looked like dirt/dust (not carbon). Water cloudy at first so flushed several gallons. Water still seems to have small white particles. Water pressure definitely drops significantly after installation. Chose this brand for the more secure metal fittings. But the careless packaging doesn’t engender confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This is not accurate: "LASTS FOR A MINIMUM OF 3 YEARS"
customer_reviews.text: Their listing on Amazon says LASTS FOR A MINIMUM OF 3 YEARS OR 10,000 GALLONS. The "or" is the key here as all of their printed literature in the box says 1 year or 10,000 gallons. If you know how to detach and re-attach a sink water line from the faucet you can install this. (An adjustable wrench and ideally another wrench or pliers will suffice.) There is some water flow reduction for sure, but it's not a problem. We'll probably still get purified water refills from the store but this is probably an ok option.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Chlorine be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this installed on my refrigerator water line for a couple of weeks and it’s doing a great job! No more chlorine taste. This is a much better filter than the ones that actually go inside the fridge. I’m sure this would be great for under the sink, too, since that’s what is is set up for.
customer_reviews.author: Masroe

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective
customer_reviews.text: Installation took about 15 minutes and there is a noticeable improvement in water quality. Flow is naturally reduced by a small amount but the reduction is minimal. We still have good water pressure from the line. Excellent filtration system.
customer_reviews.author: Krote345

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely FANTASTIC! We had our water tested in our newly built home and the water tested perfectly ... that is ... until we actually tasted it. It tasted like metal. Not wanting to spend thousands of dollars on a whole house water filtration system led me to Amazon....Then I went searching for a filter system for under the kitchen sink. This product has completely removed the metal taste from my water and now tastes the way water should taste! Delicious! No more bottled water for us! Super easy to install as well! GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Conducted a fun blind taste test with Poland Spring, unfiltered tap, filtered with Woder, and filtered with Brita. The water from the Woder came in 2nd to Poland Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great filter.
customer_reviews.text: We all know they are poisoning us with water. So we purchased this filter. It was easy to install, the most difficult part was the mounting bracket, but it was still pretty simple. Bernie Sanders could probably install it. The water taste great and has lasted for 3 months so far.
customer_reviews.author: Coolhanddav

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, great result
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, easy to install into standard water connectors that almost all houses since the 1970's have. Our water was strong tasting, mostly due to mineral content (not sulfur). The filter reduces these taste contaminants and our water is nice for drinking and making coffee. After a few days, got even better. Very happy with the results. I had reverse osmosis (RO) in last house. This costs less and does so well I have no regrets in not getting the RO again.
customer_reviews.author: Ronh

customer_reviews.title: great filter
customer_reviews.text: I live in a hundred year old house in a city where all of the infrastructure is older. Tap water is leaded nasty. I only used it for washing dishes. After using a Brita for two years, I purchased this filter. Come on over. I will give you a glass of tap water and you would not be able to tell the difference between it and bottled water. Love my 10K-Gen3.
customer_reviews.author: countrygirlNOLA

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to install, minimum mess, great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of filtration devices and this is by far the easiest to install (critical point: high quality connections and minimal opportunities for leakage.) I love the longevity of the product service period. I expect to be a happy customer for a long time -- I installed three at two different locations. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: jcousie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I was trilled to find that this item was that easy install, only a cordless drill and a pair of adjustable wrenches. There is no need to disconnect supply line from faucet, that line goes directly to attached outlet hose and fitting on the unit. However do a bit more browsing and there's a similar if not the same unit available by the seller/maker for $69 US. When available...
customer_reviews.author: roland gee

customer_reviews.title: Great "under sink" water filter for drinking purposes
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install! After clearing the grey (carbin residue) by running the water for 10 minutes, we both agreed that the water tastes much better. We are in a big city in southern Virginia that is recognized as one with an excellent water treatment service. I highly recommend this to anyone that is dealing with foul tasting and smelling water from the tap.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Geek

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get rid of the slow faucet filter. Very good
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a water filer that removed lead metals and chlorine. I Dont trust old pipes in the city. Filter was easy to install and i only noticed a small drop in pressure. Water tastes good and helped me get rid of the faucet filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This filter keeps our tap water's PH at a good level between 7
customer_reviews.text: Just installed the 3-d generation Woder a few days ago. This filter keeps our tap water's PH at a good level between 7.5-8.0, mildly alkaline. No chlorine smell; the water tastes smooth and good. In comparison, our old filter made water totally "clean" from everything and dropped PH, made it slightly acidic -- good for certain things, but maybe not the best option for everyday consumption. So our hopes are quite high with Woder. Will see how it goes over time. So far so good. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Boris Andreev / Sarah Daniels

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Water does taste better
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this installed for about two weeks and so far so good. I replaced the filter I had from a different manufacturer that I bought from a Big Box store that only lasted a month before the water pressure dropped to a trickle. This filter gave me better water pressure from the get go I'm hoping this one lasts longer than the other brand I had. I'll try to update my review in 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: George Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, great flow rate!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: My husband said it was easy to install. Unfortunately our remodeled bathroom didn’t have the same connection so we had to put it in a different bathroom. But the water quality is amazing! I did a blind taste test with each of my family members. And they “without a doubt” were able to tell the difference. And the flow rate of the water coming out of the faucet has not changed. Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dott21

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install, and tastes better
customer_reviews.text: It took me 5 minutes to install from unpackaging to using it. The water does taste better, we did a blind test on our roommate and he could identify the filtered (better tasting) water with 100% accuracy. Will update in the future regarding the longevity of the filter itself.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great water filter
customer_reviews.text: Great water filter. For the most part it was easy to install. Fits under the sink very well and the life span on one filter is good. Very glad I bought this product. Make sure after you install the product to let the water run for about 30 minutes, I know it is a waste so I just filled up some buckets, mopped the house and watered my plants. Water tasted much better too after the install. No more buying water or filling up 5 gallon jugs!
customer_reviews.author: PHILIP S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome inline refrigerator filter
customer_reviews.text: Installed as inline refrigerator water/ice 'pre'filter replacing a standard inline filter. Water flow is awesome and ice cubes are extremely soft. Highly recommend! Note that I withheld a 5star rating as there was no option to convert in/output size for refrigerator thus me and the Ace Hardware guy figured out the additional parts needed.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lastname

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water!
customer_reviews.text: I initially had a problem with my recently ordered filter providing water that was of lower quality than I remember. But, after contacting the company about the issue they provided me with another filter that definitely delivered the same great tasting water that I remember from my first purchase a few years ago. Thanks again for making great products and keeping your customers happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: we have been using for about a month now and couldn't be happier. the taste of our water is so much better. we were using Brita filters for years due to the horrible New York water. i have been looking for a replacement to filter our water with but these water filtration systems seem so complicated and take up so much space under sink. this is the perfect product for resolving this issue. love it and will be purchasing another for our ice maker unit.
customer_reviews.author: tonygnewyork

customer_reviews.title: More like 2 Minutes Per Gallon instead of 2 Gallons Per Minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter because they said the flow is 2 GPM which is okay for drinking water but this unit drop my water flow from almost 7 Gallons Per Minute without the filter to a little over a Half a Gallon Per Minute with the filter so sad to say I have to return this filter and get one that can produce at least 2 GPM. I really wish they would have been honest about the flow and saved me some time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: FWIW be mindful of gpm/flow rate...
customer_reviews.text: Woder filters work great. Having one in another sink, I decided to “upgrade” to this one where a replacement filter can just be unscrewed/screwed in vs having to replace the whole thing. Once installed, the reduced flow was immediately noticeable compared to the other model. I returned this one and ordered the  model. For me, flow/gpm is more important than ease of replacement and possible savings on future replacement filters.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Add me to the list of believers
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading my faucet, including adding this filter, was one of the best things I did last year. Very easy to install, and the water tastes great. For cold water, there is a reduction in water flow. It's not that noticeable, if I fill up a water bottle or something like that, that's the only time it takes a little longer. But it's still way faster and easier than using a Britta, and works way better than a Britta!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Auden

customer_reviews.title: Quick install - great tasting water !!!
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 10 minutes to mount the filter under the sink and connect to the cold water line. Water tastes fine (again you cannot expect a bottled water taste) and the good thing is that its filtered for all cooking and cleaning activities. The flow is reduced for sure (comparing cold and hot water separately) but that is ok by me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Raghavan

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter.
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I purchased this filter. Got it installed and it actually worked. Water tasted better with no sediment. I was disappointed in the reduction of water pressure. The drop was significant. I was expecting some drop off, but not this much. I chose to order and install a separate drinking faucet and installed the filter to use the faucet. This setup works great. It's an easy install.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Rose

customer_reviews.title: charcoal in-line water filter serves our needs well.
customer_reviews.text: this water filter is replacing a moen system. the tubing is larger than the moen. the water flows faster. it is meant to be an cold water in line filter. ours is attached to a separate faucet which we already had installed. it works well, and the taste is clean. our previous filters needed replacement every 6 months and were difficult to install. our plumber installed the system. we are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: donna mcfadden

customer_reviews.title: Works great once hooked up
customer_reviews.text: Works great once hooked up. I had trouble finding the correct converters I needed and support wasn't willing to assist. However, once finding them it works as expected, overall happy but I'm surprised company does not offer advice in finding the right parts. My issue was I had a 1/4" male fitting on my existing pipe that the inlet needed to hook into. After a couple stops to various hardware stores with no luck I found this on Amazon which did the trick: LASCO 17-6759 1/4-Inch Female Compression by 3/8-Inch Male Compression Brass Adapter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, for clean water
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, except for working under the sink. This is no fault of this product of course. The water taste and smells somewhat better. There is alot of air in water now. Water pressure is a bit lower.Woyld be nice if it came with something to test before and after results.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Hogg Jr Skip

product_meta.title: Woder WD-S-8K-DC Water Filtration System - WQA Certified – USA Made Ultra High Capacity Direct Connect Under Sink Water Filter - Removes Chlorine, Lead, Chromium 6, Heavy Metals, Odors/Contaminants
feature_bullets: This filter should be used in conjunction with municipally treated drinking water or water that has been properly disinfected prior use.

ULTRA HIGH CAPACITY - LASTS FOR A MINIMUM OF 3 YEARS OR 8,480 GALLONS - Notes: For longest life, use with municipal treated cold water only, not well water. Do not use with salty or softened water. Connects for use only with cold water for drinking.

USA MADE - NO PLUMBING REQUIRED – Comes with ‘Direct Connect’ hoses that fit standard 3/8” water valves under US kitchen and bathroom sinks. The 3/8” Direct Connect Hose are made to install directly to the existing cold water valve and faucet stem under your sink. Replacement filters ASIN B0144MFN92.
WQA GOLD SEAL CERTIFIED to NSF/ANSI 42 for Chlorine, taste, odor and NSF/ANSI 372 for lead free compliance as verified and substantiated by test data. Flow rate 2GPM @65 psig

SELECTIVE FILTRATION - Woder filters have a unique technology that removes over 99.99% of contaminants while leaving in all essential minerals (Reverse osmosis filter out everything, including the minerals your body needs. As far as nutrition goes, experts consider it essentially dead water).

PURE AND HEALTHY WATER – WITH NO MORE BOTTLES IN THE FRIDGE - Eliminates lead (99.9%), heavy metals, chlorine (99.9%), chromium 6, mercury, volatile organic compounds, carcinogens, and other contaminants, as well as turbidity, odors and bad tastes, so you and your family enjoy pure, healthy, spring-fresh water from the tap.
